intro: Tristemma hirtum, commonly known as the hairy tristema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Tristemma hirtum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
